terms.name: Acoustic Wave Equation
terms.description: The acoustic wave equation governs the propagation of acoustic waves through a material medium.

terms.name: Actuator Line Method
terms.description: A method which applies a body force, based on tabular data, along lines corresponding to individual rotor blades.

terms.name: Blade Element Momentum Theory
terms.description: Analytical method for determining the power and forces generated by a rotor, taking into account its angular momentum.

terms.name: Boundary Element Method (BEM)
terms.description: Computational method of solving linear partial differential equations (such as Laplace's equation), e.g. for potential flow.

terms.name: Boussinesq
terms.description: An approximation for water waves that is valid for weakly non-linear and fairly long waves.

terms.name: Bubble Image Velocimetry (BIV)
terms.description: Processing of images of tracer bubbles (in an Eulerian frame of reference) to determine the velocity field of a fluid in an experiment.

terms.name: Cable Routing
terms.description: Algorithms for determining the optimal positioning of cables within a farm of devices.

terms.name: Cartesian Cut-Cell
terms.description: Computational method that uses a Cartesian grid over most of the domain with cells cut into a smaller irregular cells when intersected by a boundary.

terms.name: Computational Fluid Dynamics (CFD)
terms.description: General computational methods for solving the Navier-Stokes equations.

terms.name: Conservation Planning
terms.description: The process of locating, configuring, implementing and maintaining areas that are managed to promote the persistence of biodiversity and other natural values.

terms.name: Cummins Equation
terms.description: The Cummins equation is commonly used to express the motion behaviour of a floating offshore structure.

terms.name: Data Acquisition
terms.description: Sampling signals and converting the resulting samples into digital numeric values.

terms.name: Discrete Vortex Method
terms.description: A numerical technique for the solution of the two-dimensional Navier-Stokes equations in vorticity-transport form.

terms.name: Distribution Management System (DMS)
terms.description: Applications designed to monitor & control the entire distribution network efficiently and reliably.

terms.name: Ecological Risk Assessment
terms.description: The process for evaluating how likely it is that the environment might be impacted as a result of exposure to one or more environmental stressors.

terms.name: Energy Balance
terms.description: Verification and analysis of emergence, transformation and use of energy sources within an economic zone.

terms.name: Environmental Contours
terms.description: A method to define multivariate extremes based on a joint probabilistic model of variables.

terms.name: Euler Equations
terms.description: The Navier-Stokes equations with zero viscosity and zero thermal conductivity.

terms.name: Extreme Value Analysis
terms.description: A branch of statistics dealing with the extreme deviations from the median of probability distributions.

terms.name: Finite Difference Method
terms.description: Finite difference methods simulate physical phenomena by discretizing a domain into small elements, using a regular grid.

terms.name: Finite Element Analysis
terms.description: Finite Element Analysis simulates physical phenomena by discretizing a domain into small elements, using an unstructured mesh.

terms.name: Geographic Information System (GIS)
terms.description: Relating to databases for geographic data and tools to manipulate that data.

terms.name: High-Order Spectral
terms.description: The solution of differential equations as a sum of high-order "basis functions" with coefficients chosen to satisfy the differential equation as well as possible.

terms.name: Image Processing
terms.description: Processing digital images through an algorithm.

terms.name: Incompressible Navier-Stokes
terms.description: The incompressible from of the Navier-Stokes equations.

terms.name: Internet of Things (IoT)

terms.name: Inverse First-Order Reliability Method
terms.description: A semi-probabilistic reliability analysis method devised to evaluate the reliability of a system.

terms.name: Jensen's Wake Model
terms.description: An analytical method for determining the velocity within the wake of a turbine.

terms.name: Large Eddy Simulation (LES)
terms.description: Direct simulation of the Navier-Stokes equations replacing small scale phenomena with analytical solutions.

terms.name: Life Cycle Assessment
terms.description: A methodology for assessing environmental impacts associated with all the stages of the life cycle of a commercial product, process, or service.

terms.name: Linear Wave Theory

terms.name: Logistics
terms.description: Relating to the process of acquisition, storage, and transportation of components.

terms.name: Lumped Mass Method (LMM)
terms.description: An approximation to a long continuous mass using discrete point masses.

terms.name: Maximum Likelihood Estimation
terms.description: A method of estimating the parameters of an assumed probability distribution, given some observed data.

terms.name: Mechanics
terms.description: The area of mathematics and physics concerned with the relationships between force, matter, and motion among physical objects.

terms.name: Modal Analysis
terms.description: The study of the dynamic properties of systems in the frequency domain.

terms.name: Moment Matching
terms.description: An approximation based on interpolating a certain number of points on the complex plane, termed moments.

terms.name: Morrison's Equation
terms.description: Used for calculating the wave loads on fixed vertical cylinders.

terms.name: Motion Detection
terms.description: The process of detecting a change in the position of an object relative to its surroundings.

terms.name: Multipole Expansion
terms.description: An angle based mathematical series which is used to approximate functions, such as for boundary element methods.

terms.name: Natural Language Processing (NLP)
terms.description: Processing and analyzing of large amounts of natural language data by computers.

terms.name: Optical Flow
terms.description: Relating to the pattern of apparent motion of objects, surfaces, and edges in a visual scene caused by the relative motion between an observer and a scene.

terms.name: Optimal Power Flow
terms.description: Algorithms for optimising the costs of an electrical network.

terms.name: Optimization
terms.description: Algorithms for automatic minimization of some cost function.

terms.name: Panel Method
terms.description: Numerical schemes for solving potential flow problems using a series of singularities.

terms.name: Particle Image Velocimetry (PIV)
terms.description: Processing of images of tracer seed particles (in an Eulerian frame of reference) to determine the velocity field of a fluid in an experiment.

terms.name: Potential Flow
terms.description: Fluid flow where the velocity field is described as the gradient of a scalar function, known as the velocity potential, typically used for incompressible flow.

terms.name: Primitive Equations

terms.name: Pseudo-Spectral
terms.description: A spectral method applied in a discrete space.

terms.description: Tracking the motion of tracer seed particles (in a Lagrangian frame of reference) to determine the velocity field of a fluid in an experiment.

terms.name: Quasi-Static Loads
terms.description: Related to solid mechanics algorithms where inertial effects are considered to be negligible.

terms.name: Robotics Middleware
terms.description: Middleware to be used in complex robot control software systems.

terms.name: SCADA
terms.description: Supervisory control and data acquisition (SCADA) is a control system for high-level supervision of machines and processes.

terms.name: Shallow Water Equations
terms.description: Depth-integrated form of the Navier-Stokes equations, where the horizontal length scale is much greater than the vertical length scale.

terms.name: Shape Analysis
terms.description: The automatic analysis of geometric shapes.

terms.name: Smoothed-Particle Hydrodynamics (SPH)
terms.description: The discretization of a continuous medium is into a set of particles that interact with each other and move at the fluid's velocity.

terms.name: State Space
terms.description: A model of a physical system as a set of input, output and state variables related by first-order differential equations or difference equations.

terms.name: Static Loads
terms.description: Solid mechanics analysis where loads don't change with time.

terms.name: Statistics
terms.description: Relating to the application of probability theory to data.

terms.name: Stream Function
terms.description: A function where flow velocity components can be determined from its derivatives.

terms.name: Subsurface Science
terms.description: Relating to subterranean processes, such as subsurface flows.

terms.name: Tidal Harmonics
terms.description: The representation of tides as the superposition of basic waves using Fourier analysis.

terms.name: Verification and Validation
terms.description: Relating to the processes for quantifying and building confidence (or credibility) in numerical models.

terms.name: Vortex Lattice Method (VLM)
terms.description: A method which models a lifting surface as an infinitely thin sheet of discrete vortices.

terms.name: Vortex Particle Method (VPM)
terms.description: A mesh-free approach to computational fluid dynamics, where fluid is discretized into discrete particles.

terms.name: Vorticity Transport Equation
terms.description: An equation that describes the evolution of the vorticity of a particle of an incompressible fluid as it moves.

terms.name: Wave Spectral Analysis
terms.description: Discretisation and analysis of ocean wave energy as frequencies of wave-lengths.

terms.name: Wind Wave Model
terms.description: Models which predict sea states and the evolution of the energy of wind waves subject to forcing from wind and/or tides.
